titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Judy Woodruff papers, 1980-2009 and undated RL.11852
titlestmt.author: Megan E. Lewis

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-09-17 08:33:10 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Judy Woodruff is a broadcast journalist covering U.S. politics whose career has spanned work at NBC, CNN, and PBS. This collection documents her professional life, consisting of extensive research and subject files, correspondence including viewer mail, speaking appearances and engagements, and service including the Duke University Board of Trustees and the Interntional Women's Media Foundation.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials are still in original housing which may be sealed with tape. Staff will need to open box to facilitate researcher access.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Judy Woodruff papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2014.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials remain in the order in which they were received, and the series were derived from the donor's groupings. The collection guide is divided into series which are then sorted chronologically.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Judy Woodruff (b. 1946) is a broadcast journalist who has covered politics and other news for networks including NBC, CNN, and PBS over a career that began in the early 1970s. After graduating from Duke University, Woodruff began working at a local Atlanta ABC affiliate. Her national profile rose when she covered Jimmy Carter's 1976 election, which took her to NBC, where she became a political correspondent. Her long association with PBS began in 1983, when she became the chief Washington correspondent for the MacNeil/Lehrer NewsHour. From 1993-2005, Woodruff worked with CNN, where she anchored the show Inside Politics. She has also taught courses at both Harvard and Duke. Since 2011, she has anchored news shows including the PBS NewsHour and made Frontline documentaries for PBS. She has served on the Board of Trustees of Duke University and the Duke Endowment, and is a co-founder of the International Women's Media Foundation.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Judy Woodruff papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Megan E. Lewis, July 2020
Accessions described in this collection guide: 2014-0042

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The collection includes files documenting Woodruff's journalism career with CBS, NBC, the MacNeil/Lehrer NewsHour, CNN and other news outlets as well as her service at Duke on the Board of Trustees, and the board of the International Women's Media Foundation. Files range from extensive research and subject files to project files, viewer correspondence, interview material, writings, speeches, and audio/visual materials.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials must be reformatted before use.

controlaccess.subject: Press and politics -- United States
Women in television broadcasting -- United States
Women in the broadcasting industry -- United States
controlaccess.corpname: Sallie Bingham Center for Women's History and Culture

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains materials used by Woodruff in the production of her work. Includes research files, subject files, notebooks, blue cards, and personal notes. Topics include PBS research, MacNeil Lehrer research, Interviews, Politics, and the Middle East.

did.unittitle: UN World Conference on Women, Bejing, Women Research
Convention Political Guide, Democratic Convention Chicago, Logistics, Clippings, CNN Guide to Coverage, ABA Commission on Women Panel

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These materials consist of Woodruff's professional correspondence and a substantial amount of viewer mail.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This grouping contains materials documenting Woodruff's appearances at events, including her speeches. It also includes materials documenting her service on various boards, including the Duke University Board of Trustees and the Duke Endowment.

did.unittitle: Board Meetings, Executive Committee, East European Congress
International Women's Media Foundation Africa Trip

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These materials chiefly document Woodruff's career, including press coverage, awards, and biographies. Also includes contact lists, calendars, ephemera, printed materials, organizational files, and a photo album from the 1995 Beijing Women's Conference.
